subject: Re: how to transcribe air and ear
msgSnippet: ... Allow me to suggest example words for each letter from many accents and, just as importantly, which letters never to use. And further let me propose that
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "paulhtremblay" <phthenry@...>
>
> Yes, of course! Now you are just repeating the obvious. That is what I
> am trying to establish here. So what should that policy be--how should
> we understand the letters?
>

Allow me to suggest example words for each letter from many accents
and, just as importantly, which letters never to use. And further let me
propose that the makers of the examples be native speakers of that
accent and that they can correctly infer Read's intent for each
letter. I believe incidentally, the group is very well equipped to do
this. Indeed I imagine everyone reading this post could easily do theirs.
